author: TD

review: I've owned the original Roku box for years.  Back then, the concept of streaming video like from Netflix, was a revelation.  Recently, every device under the sun streams video.  But, if you don't have a tv or blu ray or video game console that offers streaming video, the Roku Stick is the best bang for your hard earned buck.  For less than $50, you get all the features and channels you can expect other (more expensive) streaming devices.Quick word of wisdom: plug the Roku Stick into a power outlet, not your tv's USB port.  Trust me, if your tv is anything like mine, there is a performance difference.

author: Stuart Hershkowitz

review: Took me a while to adjust to ignoring the TV channels lineup, but now I'm in the groove and watch whole series, episode by episode.  Some reviewers have indicated thaey needed super fast internet speed, but I have found my moderate speed service works fine.  Sometimes I find that the sound runs but the picture is replaced by an orchid pink screen, but I figured out that it's because the modem needs to be reset -- usually after electrical interference during a storm.  Cut my cable bill drastically and enjoying my TV more than ever.
